clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Fasting-mimicking Diet on Immunosenescence and Vaccination in Older Adults: A Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to test a Fasting-Mimicking Diet (FMD) for its efficacy on improving immune response to flu vaccination in an older adult population (50-75 years of age).

detailed_description.textblock: This is a randomized clinical trial to test the safety and efficacy of the fasting-mimicking diet (FMD) in an elderly population (50-75 years of age) receiving their annual influenza vaccination. The study will include two arms: Control (normal diet) and FMD (2 cycles of 5-day fasting-mimicking diet within two months). Participants both arms will receive the standard influenza vaccine.The primary endpoint is anti-influenza antibody titers measured 4 weeks after flu vaccination. Secondary endpoints include: (1) body composition changes, measured as BMI, waist to hip ratio; (2) physiological changes, measured as blood chemistry and motor performance; (3) health outcomes, measured by SF-36 Health survey, dry eye surveys and flu incidents within 12 months of vaccination.

primary_outcome.measure: Anti-Influenza Serum antibody titers 4 weeks after flu vaccination
primary_outcome.description: The ratio of post vaccine to pre vaccine titers will be calculated A positive titer is defined as 1:40 or greater.

secondary_outcome.description: Body composition changes, measured as BMI, waist to hip ratio
Physiological changes measured as blood chemistry and motor performance
Health outcomes measured by SF-36 Health survey.
Self-reporting of flu incidence; Self-reporting of flu symptom severity on a 0-5 scale.
Dry eye condition measured by the Ocular Surface Disease Index (OSDI) questionnaire and the Dry Dye Severity Questionnaire (DESQ).

arm_group.description: Participants will receive Seasonal influenza (flu) vaccine.
Participants will consume 2 cycles of a 5-day low calorie fasting-mimicking diet with approximately 3 weeks of gap period prior to receiving standard Seasonal influenza (flu) vaccine.

intervention.description: Seasonal influenza (flu) vaccine Fluzone Quadrivalent Vaccine (Sanofi Pasteur), for participants ages 50 - 64 years old Fluzone High-Dose (Sanofi Pasteur), for participants ages 65 years and older
